intro: Schoenoplectus triqueter f. pallidus, commonly known as the pale triquetrous sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh environments. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in shallow water or moist soils and is often found in temperate regions. Its pale green coloration and robust growth make it a notable species in aquatic ecosystems.
